issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.customfield_12310192: Added new envs to separate heap size for different daemons started via bin scripts.

status.name: Resolved

fields.summary: JobHistory web services are slower then the UI and can easly overload the JH

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description: Currently the heap size for all of these is set in yarn-env.sh.  JAVA_HEAP_MAX is set to -Xmx1000m unless YARN_HEAPSIZE is set.  If it is set it will override JAVA_HEAP_MAX.  However, we do not always want to have the RM, NM, and HistoryServer with the exact same heap size.  It would be logical to have inside of yarn and mapred to set JAVA_HEAP_MAX if YARN_RESOURCEMANAGER_HEAPSIZE, YARN_NODEMANAGER_HEAPSIZE or HADOOP_JOB_HISTORYSERVER_HEAPSIZE are set respectively.  This is a bug because it is easy to configure the history server to store more entires then the heap can hold.  It is also a performance issue if we do not allow the history server to cache many entries on a large cluster.
fields.summary: Clean up passing HEAPSIZE to yarn and mapred commands.

comments.body: There are no tests in this patch as it is just script changes, but I manually tested on a single node cluster.
The above patch has no documentation either.  I will update the docs and resubmit.
Docs added.

-1 overall.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12516734/MR-3954.txt
  against trunk revision .

    +1 @author.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    -1 tests included.  The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
                        Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
                        Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

    +1 javadoc.  The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

    +1 javac.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

    +1 eclipse:eclipse.  The patch built with eclipse:eclipse.

    +1 findbugs.  The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

    +1 release audit.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

    +1 core tests.  The patch passed unit tests in .

    +1 contrib tests.  The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/1976//testReport/
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/1976//console

This message is automatically generated.

Mostly looks good. And thanks for updating the docs. A couple minor documentation nits.  

- can you update the comment Environment Variables section at the top of bin/yarn for the new variables
- you might add a header to the table in the ClusterSetup - with Daemon | Environment Variable
- You didn't change this so its optional. It might be nice in ClusterSetup to say that you configure it size in MB but you leave off the m. Because when I read that I thought I would set the env var to 1000MB.

Looks good to me too, besides comments from Thomas.

+1 for comments (1) and (3) above. Cannot understand (2). Canceling the patch to address these comments.

I addressed the comments.  

* I updated the comment in the yarn command.  I even remved the YARN_NAMENODE_OPTS section that looks like a copy and paste error.
* I added the header to the table in the documentation.
* I made it clearer in the documentation that you set the variable to be 1000 and not 1000MB.

-1 overall.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12517092/MR-3954.txt
  against trunk revision .

    +1 @author.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    -1 tests included.  The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
                        Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
                        Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

    +1 javadoc.  The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

    +1 javac.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

    +1 eclipse:eclipse.  The patch built with eclipse:eclipse.

    +1 findbugs.  The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

    +1 release audit.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

    -1 core tests.  The patch failed these unit tests:
                  org.apache.hadoop.mapred.TestJobClientGetJob
                  org.apache.hadoop.mapred.TestMRWithDistributedCache
                  org.apache.hadoop.mapred.TestLocalModeWithNewApis

    +1 contrib tests.  The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/1999//testReport/
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/1999//console

This message is automatically generated.

The latest patch looks good. The test failures are unrelated, we have to investigate separately.

Updating patch fixing a small typo. Not running it through Jenkins.

+1. Pushing this the updated patch.

bq.  The test failures are unrelated, we have to investigate separately.
Figured this as a Jenkins issue. Happens intermittently, perhaps because of some permissions issues.
Just committed this to trunk, branch-0.23 and branch-0.23.2. Thanks Robert!
